{{Wired embedded system |brand=Scientific Atlanta |model=DCX2100 |revision= |asin= |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=cable modem |est_release_date=11/2003 |fcc_date= |fcc_id= |pcb_id= |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM3348;BCM3348KPB; |cpu1_cspeed=200 |fla1=2 |fla1_brand=AMD |fla1_model=AM29LV160B |ram1=8 |ram1_brand=ESMT |ram1_model=M12L64164A |expansion_if_types=USB 1.1 |expansion_usb_num=1 |jtag= |serial= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports= |addl_chips=Digital Cable Tuner;Broadcom;BCM3415;BCM3415KQTE;1; ,,, Cable Modem LNA;Broadcom;BCM3401;;1; |flags=DOCSIS 2.0 |stock_boot= |stock_os= |tp_firmware= |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui_eth=00:14:F8 }}
"PCB MADE IN CHINA" and a date code of '''0348''' is silkscreened on the board.
*[[Scientific Atlanta WebSTAR DCX2100]] - DOCSIS 2.0 • [https://www.microcontrollertips.com/teardown-inside-cable-modem/ Teardown] :CPU: [[Broadcom]] BCM3348 @200MHz; Flash/RAM: 2MB/8MB :[[Broadcom]] BCM3348KPB QAMLink‚ DOCSIS 2.0 Modem :Flash: [[AMD]] AM29LV160B 2MB (2M x 8-Bit/1M x 16-Bit) :RAM: ''ESMT'' M12L64164A 8MB (1M x 16-Bit x 4 Banks) SDRAM :Cable tuner: [[Broadcom]] BCM3415; LNA: [[Broadcom]] BCM3401 :[[Broadcom]] BCM3415KQTE - Digital Cable Tuner :''Unisonic Technologies'' MC34063A - DC to DC Converter Controller :[[Micrel]] LF-H41S - 10Base-T/100Base-TX Physical Layer Transceiver :[[Texas Instruments]] SN75240/SN65240/SN65220 - USB Suppressor :SAW EPCOS 1603; SAW Multimedia Filter X6864D
